Original: traces matter! Viv @Vtrivedy10 standard awesome Anthropic blog, I cannot stress the importance of this step enough â€”> pls look at the agent traces!!! TONS of value in understanding if an agent â€œfailed a taskâ€ then: 1. how did it fail? (formatting error, logical error, went down wrong track in planning, environment bugâ€¦) 2. did it actually fail? should you update your grading if it was wrong? 3. what were successful patterns vs failing patterns (stratify across pass and fail and see the steps) 4. link it back to your instructions and tools/skills. did you not give the right tool to do the task? Are instructions ambiguous? Agent building is a deeply iterative process and this is literally theâ€¦

Original: Need a full post on â€œtraces are the lifeblood of agent improvement loopsâ€ Viv @Vtrivedy10 banger post ğŸ”¥ traces are the lifeblood of agent improvement loops the first step towards â€œhow do i make this agent better?â€ is â€œwhat is my agent doing?â€ â€”> turning on tracing is how you kickstart this loop itâ€™s not just talk, at LangChain we literally do this all the time, our default for debugging agents is: â€œcan you share a traceâ€? it drastically speeds up our development loops because us (usually us + an agent) can immediately see what happened down to each tool call input, latency, tokens, etc and test fizes to compare behavior itâ€™s gonna be a fun time seeing more and helping more ppl improve agentsâ€¦

---
Original: âœ’ï¸How I built an AI agent to automate my emails with LangSmith Agent Builder LangSmith Agent Builder is a no-code agent builder. I built an email assistant to monitor and respond to emails, that I've been using for the last ~3 months. Here's what it looks like: 1/ Triggers: it is triggered by incoming emails. I don't have to do any work to kick it off - it just runs automatically 2/ Tools via MCP: connects to gmail (read emails, send email) and gcal (read calendar, read events, create event) 3/ Human in the loop: the "write" actions (sending email, creating calendar) require human approval to run. More on this later - but wanted to highlight that it's able to go completely wild! 4/ Subagentâ€¦
